intro: Zeuxine curvata, commonly known as the bent-stalk zeuxine, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant features delicate, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers with five petals. Zeuxine curvata typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest floors or wet meadows. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
